email.title: Weekly Digest

image.alt: Stack of biscuits on a plate
image.title: I can't think of an alt text for this one

email.text:
Welcome to another digest!
Last week was yet another busy week for DoCSoc, with over _100_ members attending the LSEG talk and 80 members attending the G-Research Coding Challenge. As usual, thanks to everyone who attended and a special thanks to our volunteers!
One thing to note from us: if you're attending an event, be sure to click _Going_ on Facebook so we can order enough food and drinks in advance.
Over the next week, we will be holding an ice skating trip, hosting a cybersecurity talk from Facebook and releasing tickets for a trip to watch The Book of Mormon. With DevFest on the 1st of December too, the next fortnight will be busy and exciting. And don't forget: Liquidnet are hosting a talk and an _office visit_, which will be great casual event for those looking to network over a few drinks. Read on for more details!
email.heading: DevFest Volunteers and IC Hack 19 Organisers
email.text:
This academic year, we're not only hosting our flagship hackathon, IC Hack 19 (26/27th Jan 2019), but also Google DevFest London (1st Dec 2018)!
For IC Hack in particular, we're looking for organisers taking on responsibilities beyond the standard volunteering role. We held our initial volunteers' meeting last week, with minutes available on the IC Hack 19 Slack (joinable via DoCSoc: Operations). On the Slack channel, you'll be able to choose whether you want to take part in Logistics, Finance, Marketing and Hacker Experience.
To get involved, join the [DoCSoc: Operations](https://www.facebook.com/groups/1509850436007222/) Facebook group and learn more about organising IC Hack [here](https://www.facebook.com/groups/1509850436007222/permalink/2300633930262198/).
email.heading: Careers Service: Start-Up and SME Week
email.text: The Careers Service is hosting a series of events related to SMEs and start-ups from 19th - 23rd November. For more information, see the PDF attached and be sure to book the events on [JobsLive](http://www.imperial.ac.uk/careers/services/jobslive/).
email.heading: DoCSoc Goes Ice Skating

event.location: Natural History Museum, Cromwell Road, London, SW7 5BD
event.text:
Get out your scarf and gloves, and join us at the Natural History Museum for our annual ice skating spectacular on Tuesday 20th November at 6:30pm and Wednesday 21st November at 5:30pm, followed by one free drink at the end.
Please ensure that you only attend the session that you have bought tickets for.
If you were lucky enough to secure a ticket last week, we hope to see you there!

email.heading: Cyber Security at Facebook

event.text:
RSVP here: https://cybersecurityfacebook.splashthat.com/
Interested in becoming a Security Engineer? Want to help us catch the bad guys? We are excited to invite you to an information session and an evening of pizza and drinks with the Facebook Security Engineering team!
More than two billion people around the world use Facebook to connect with their friends, family, and communities. Facebook Security understands the importance of keeping those interactions secure, and the team strives each day to create and maintain the safest environment possible for the people on Facebook and their data.
You will have an opportunity to hear from Engineers in our Product Security Assessment & Analysis and Computer & Emergency Response teams, as well as representatives from the University Recruitment team. You can hear more about our 2019 Security Internship opportunities and we will give you information for the application process. The evening will finish off with pizza, swag giveaways and networking!
If you have any specific dietary requirements, please let us know a few days beforehand. **Don't forget to click 'Going' on Facebook so we can order enough pizza!**

email.heading: DoCSoc Goes to the Book of Mormon

event.location: Prince of Wales Royal Theatre, 31 Coventry Street, London W1D 6AS
event.text:
Due to popular demand, DoCSoc is going for a trip to the multi award-winning musical, The Book of Mormon, on Monday 26th of November at 7pm.
Tickets will be heavily subsidised to £20 so join us in a fun evening of music and comedy!
Tickets for this event will go on sale on Thursday 22nd November at 1pm.

event.location: King's Business School, Bush House, 30 Aldwych, WC2B 4BG London, United Kingdom
event.text:
**Blockchain Idea Competition, >£80k in cash prizes**
**3rd and 4th year projects may be entered into this competition and are actively encouraged. This competition is also open to MSc Projects being entered.** If you would like to enter your assessed project into this competition, make sure your supervisor is happy to let you do so beforehand!
Applications are now open for the Winter Cohort of the **Future of Blockchain** 3 month idea competition. Build out an idea from to demo to a panel of leading VCs at the finale in March 2019. Be supported by a mentor and bi-weekly workshops during the term on how to build a blockchain startup.
Prizes include 24 x £2,000 bounties, £20,000 top prize, £10,000 2nd prize, £5,000 3rd prizes and seed investment for viable projects that want to go full time.
You can **register interest** and find more information at http://www.futureofblockchain.co.uk/ and **RSVP for the launch event** [here](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/future-of-blockchain-london-launch-and-drinks-tickets-50175230465).

email.heading: Liquidnet In-Office Interactive Session: Trading, AI and Augmenting Behavior

event.location: Liquidnet Offices, 21st Floor, Broadgate Tower, Primrose St, London, EC2A 2EW
event.text:
JOIN LIQUIDNET CHIEF DATA SCIENTIST TOM DORIS, PHD. to discuss challenges in adoption and adherence of new technologies by human experts, deconstruct the methods that were effective in overcoming the obstacles, and review similarities across other industries.
There will be an opportunity to network with members of Tom's Technology team, our Recruitment Team and Product Team once the interactive session has ended.
Refreshments will be served.

email.heading: Google DevFest London 2018

event.text:
DoCSoc is proud to be hosting Google DevFest London on our very own campus this year! Read on for more information.
**Learn the latest in web, mobile, cloud, machine learning and more at the UK's largest community organised free conference.**
GDG London, Google and DoCSoc present GDG Devfest London - a multi-track event covering: cloud and machine learning; web; mobile; assistant; codelabs and demos.
To find out more about speakers, topics and agenda, visit devfest.gdg.london
Don’t miss out on a fun, interesting and informative day of expert speakers, demo stands coding labs and much much more.
You’ll also get the chance to network with experts from Google, Imperial College and beyond and learn more from some of the amazing developer communities we have in London.
There will be people taking photographs and potentially filming the event. By attending you agree to the possibility of being photographed and filmed once inside the venue.
Thank you for your interest in GDG DevFest London and we look forward to seeing you there!
(Tickets are sold out, so if you have a ticket but are unable to attend, please let us know so we can release your ticket to our waitlist!)

email.heading: LSEG WIN Breakfast Sessions for Young Female Talents

event.location: LSEG City of London Global Headquarters, 10 Paternoster Square, London, EC4M 7LS
event.text:
**Limited spaces available!**
The **LSEG WIN (Women Inspired Network)** Community aims to provide a platform to celebrate female talents within and outside the Group. As part of the WIN Campus Taskforce, we’d like to invite a small group of elite female students from four top London universities (LSE, UCL, KCL, and Imperial College London) to attend our breakfast sessions to understand and explore the financial industry with the help of industry leaders and senior executives.
We are excited to offer this opportunity to young talented female students to help them to gain more exposure to financial markets, whilst networking with like-minded peers.
Our last breakfast session is **Alternative Career Options in Finance**, on Wednesday, 5 December, 9:00am – 10:00am. For more details, see the PDF attached.
Location: LSEG City of London Global Headquarters, 10 Paternoster Square, London EC4M 7LS
If you're interested, email DoCSoc at docsoc@imperial.ac.uk and they'll pass your details onto us!
